name: Amitriptyline

dosing.notes: Take at bedtime. Therapeutic drug monitoring available (target 80-200 ng/mL combined amitriptyline + nortriptyline). Widely used for pain and migraine at sub-antidepressant doses.

canadian_clinical.titration_schedule: Increase by 25 mg every 5-7 days as tolerated.
canadian_clinical.inpatient_strategy: Start 25-50 mg nocte. Titrate to 100-150 mg over 1-2 weeks targeting antidepressant effect.
canadian_clinical.outpatient_strategy: Start 10-25 mg nocte for tolerability. For pain/migraine: target 25-75 mg. For depression: target 100-200 mg.
canadian_clinical.max_dose_practice: 200 mg/day (most clinicians limit here due to toxicity risk).

cautions.renal: No specific adjustment; monitor for accumulation.
cautions.hepatic: Avoid in severe hepatic impairment; reduce dose if mild-moderate.
cautions.pregnancy: Generally avoided; limited safety data, neonatal withdrawal possible.

warnings: QTc prolongation — baseline and follow-up ECG recommended
Heavy anticholinergic burden (dry mouth, constipation, urinary retention, delirium risk in elderly)
Orthostatic hypotension — fall risk especially in elderly
Not recommended as first-line in elderly (Beers Criteria)
